labels.analysis: The MCP Server specializes in providing programmatic access to an authenticated YouTube account's feed and activity. It leverages OAuth to fetch trending videos, recent uploads from subscribed channels, and user activity. This enables natural language interaction with YouTube data, eliminating the need for manual API handling and integrating YouTube content into LLM workflows.
labels.reasoning: The primary label reflects the server's focus on YouTube content interaction. Secondary labels emphasize its automation capabilities and integration potential. The custom label highlights the specific OAuth-based authentication method, which is a key distinguishing feature.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: YouTube Feed via OAuth
server_info_crawled.author: @saginawj/mcp-server-youtube
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable natural language interaction with your personal YouTube feed. Fetch trending videos, recent uploads from subscribed channels, and interact with YouTube content seamlessly through your favorite LLM client. Simplify access to YouTube data without manual API handling.

tools.name: get_trending_videos
tools.description: Deploy Server YouTube Feed via OAuth @saginawj/mcp-server-youtube Try in Playground get_trending_videos

tools.name: get_subscribed_channels
tools.description: Fetch the most recent uploads from subscribed YouTube channels.

tools.name: get_user_activity
tools.description: Fetch the most recent activity from the authenticated user.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@saginawj/mcp-server-youtube/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
